Keywords: Brotherhood of Mutants , Brute , Excalibur , Mystical , Thunderbolts , X-Men
Real Name: Cain Marko
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Hindering. This character can move through Blocking terrain. Immediately after movement resolves, destroy all Blocking terrain moved through.
MYSTICAL HELMET: Colossal Stamina. // Juggernaut can reduce penetrating damage and has PROTECTED: Outwit.
ONCE HE STARTS HE CAN'T BE STOPPED: Charge. When Juggernaut uses it, you may choose to not halve his speed. If you do, he can use [Improved Movement: Characters] and can only move in a direct path. // If Juggernaut used Charge during your last turn, he can't become Immobile.
CYTTORAK'S CHOSEN: STOP. Impervious, but succeeds on a 4-6.
NOTHING STOPS THE JUGGERNAUT: Battle Fury. Opposing characters within 4 squares can't use STOP, Leadership or Perplex. (If they already used Perplex, the modifier temporarily doesn't apply).

February 20, 2022
tidge
In the post-HoX "power creep" era, I have been trying to think of circumstances where I'd be willing to play this (very good) dial all full cost and accept the risks that come with it. I'm thinking perhaps this "X-Men" Juggernaut should consider forming a two-man band with the SR XMRF062 Apocalypse. As a force they have some mobility problems, but the Steal Energy on Juggernaut will pair just fine with his Colossal Stamina. You certainly could opt for the lower cost dial on XMRF062 to have 50 more points to play with.
August 1, 2021
Goop
175 is a lot, i like him much more at 100. Stop clicks are becoming more and more of a pain so this guy is a hard counter to it. He's also got great def and outwit protection. Just a really strong figure all around that can annihilate certain figs.

July 17, 2021
deathtrooper744
Juggernaut is not standing on a cloud of dust. Look at his back leg. It is touching the ground, not the dust. This means that he is creating that cloud of dust, not standing in it. He's in the middle of a classic Juggernaut running pose while going through a wall (the debris that's around). It's a very dynamic, large, and great sculpt. Why are you being so hard on this one, rather than the hundreds of other Heroclix sculpts that have much worse problems?

I really hate to say this, but the sculpt absolutely kills the figure for me. I mean, he's standing on a cloud of dust. Not in it, but on it. Every time I look at this fig I have to roll my eyes. I so want to just be fine with it, but it just eats at me. Just have him stand IN the cloud of dust! That's all! I am just going to have to mod this guy. And I'm really tolerant of sculpts, really I am.
